program main

  implicit none

  integer :: n, i, index_count, mask, count0, oddCount

  integer(8) :: product, input_number, value

  character(len=20) :: s_third, result

  integer, dimension(:), allocatable :: arr, indices

  character(len=20) :: binary_str, s, new_str

  ! First step: read input and compute product

  read *, n

  allocate(arr(n))

  read *, arr(1:n)

  index_count =0

  do i=1, n

     if (arr(i) ==1) then

        index_count = index_count +1

     end if

  end do

  if (index_count ==0) then

     product =0

  else

     allocate(indices(index_count))

     index_count =0

     do i=1, n

        if (arr(i) ==1) then

           index_count = index_count +1

           indices(index_count) = i-1 ! 0-based

        end if

     end do

     product =1

     do i=2, index_count

        product = product * (indices(i) - indices(i-1))

     end do

  end if

  ! Second step: compute the minimal 4/7 number >= product

  input_number = product

  mask =2

  value =0_8

  do

     ! Convert mask to binary string

     binary_str = ''

     integer :: temp = mask

     integer :: remainder

     do while (temp >0)

        remainder = mod(temp,2)

        binary_str = char(ichar('0') + remainder) // binary_str

        temp = temp /2

     end do

     ! substring from position 2

     if (len_trim(binary_str) <1) then

        s = ''

     else

        s = binary_str(2:)

     end if

     ! count zeros

     count0 =0

     do i=1, len_trim(s)

        if (s(i:i) == '0') count0 = count0 +1

     end do

     if (count0 == (len_trim(s) - count0)) then

        ! valid, replace 0→4, 1→7

        new_str = ''

        do i=1, len_trim(s)

           if (s(i:i) == '0') then

              new_str = new_str // '4'

           else

              new_str = new_str // '7'

           end if

        end do

        ! parse to value

        read(new_str, *, iostat=istat) value

        if (istat ==0 .and. value >= input_number) then

           exit

        end if

     end if

     mask = mask +1

  end do

  ! Third step: process the value as a string

  write(s_third, '(I20)') value

  s_third = adjustl(s_third)

  ! count frequencies

  integer :: count4=0, count7=0

  do i=1, len_trim(s_third) if (s_third(i:i) == '4') then

        count4 = count4 +1

     else if (s_third(i:i) == '7') then

        count7 = count7 +1

     else

        ! invalid character, but according to problem, shouldn't happen

     end if

  end do

  oddCount =0

  if (mod(count4,2) /=0) oddCount = oddCount +1

  if (mod(count7,2) /=0) oddCount = oddCount +1

  if (oddCount <=1 .or. mod(oddCount,2) /=0) then

     result = 'First'

  else

     result = 'Second'

  end if

  !

program main

  implicit none

  integer :: n, i, index_count, mask, count0, oddCount

  integer(8) :: product, input_number, value

  character(len=20) :: s_third, result

  integer, dimension(:), allocatable :: arr, indices

  character(len=20) :: binary_str, s, new_str

  ! First step: read input and compute product

  read *, n

  allocate(arr(n))

  read *, arr(1:n)

  index_count =0

  do i=1, n

     if (arr(i) ==1) then

        index_count = index_count +1

     end if

  end do

  if (index_count ==0) then

     product =0

  else

     allocate(indices(index_count))

     index_count =0

     do i=1, n

        if (arr(i) ==1) then

           index_count = index_count +1

           indices(index_count) = i-1 ! 0-based

        end if

     end do

     product =1

     do i=2, index_count

        product = product * (indices(i) - indices(i-1))

     end do

  end if

  ! Second step: compute the minimal 4/7 number >= product

  input_number = product

  mask =2

  value =0_8

  do

     ! Convert mask to binary string

     binary_str = ''

     integer :: temp = mask

     integer :: remainder

     do while (temp >0)

        remainder = mod(temp,2)

        binary_str = char(ichar('0') + remainder) // binary_str

        temp = temp /2

     end do

     ! substring from position 2

     if (len_trim(binary_str) <1) then

        s = ''

     else

        s = binary_str(2:)

     end if

     ! count zeros

     count0 =0

     do i=1, len_trim(s)

        if (s(i:i) == '0') count0 = count0 +1

     end do

     if (count0 == (len_trim(s) - count0)) then

        ! valid, replace 0→4, 1→7

        new_str = ''

        do i=1, len_trim(s)

           if (s(i:i) == '0') then

              new_str = new_str // '4'

           else

              new_str = new_str // '7'

           end if

        end do

        ! parse to value

        read(new_str, *, iostat=istat) value

        if (istat ==0 .and. value >= input_number) then

           exit

        end if

     end if

     mask = mask +1

  end do

  ! Third step: process the value as a string

  write(s_third, '(I20)') value

  s_third = adjustl(s_third)

  ! count frequencies

  integer :: count4=0, count7=0

  do i=1, len_trim(s_third)

     if (s_third(i:i) == '4') then

        count4 = count4 +1

     else if (s_third(i:i) == '7') then

        count7 = count7 +1

     else

        ! invalid character, but according to problem, shouldn't happen

     end if

  end do

  oddCount =0

  if (mod(count4,2) /=0) oddCount = oddCount +1

  if (mod(count7,2) /=0) oddCount = oddCount +1

  if (oddCount <=1 .or. mod(oddCount,2) /=0) then

     result = 'First'

  else

     result = 'Second'

  end if

  ! Output the result

  print *, trim(result)

end program main
